arm_group.description: Patients undergoing vitreoretinal surgery under monitored anesthesia care.  They will be observed during surgery and no interventions will be administered.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to determine if apnea (the stopping of breathing) occurs in
      patients undergoing undergoing monitored anesthesia care (MAC) for vitreoretinal surgery

clinical_study.brief_title: Rates of Apnea in Patients Undergoing Vitreoretinal Surgery

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients undergoing vitreoretinal surgery will be monitored during the procedure to
      determine if they stop breathing. This study is observational in nature and no interventions
      will be made.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  patients having vitreoretinal surgery under monitored anesthesia care

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  patients having vitreoretinal surgery without monitored anesthesia care

study_pop.textblock: patients having vitreoretinal surgery under monitored anesthesia care

clinical_study.official_title: Rates of Apnea in Patients Undergoing Vitreoretinal Surgery

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Determine if patients undergoing vitreoretinal surgery under monitored anesthesia care stop breathing during the procedure

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
